subject: Productivity
title: Satisficing vs Maximizing
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Satisficing vs Maximizing.

hook.text: Do you buy the first decent pair of shoes, or visit every store to find the absolute best?

buildup.text: Herbert Simon coined satisficing: accepting the first option that meets your minimum criteria.

discovery.text: Barry Schwartz found that maximizers â€” people who always seek the best â€” are less happy with their choices.

twist.text: Maximizers get objectively better outcomes but feel worse. The search itself creates regret.

climax.text: Satisficing saves time, energy, and emotional pain. Good enough really is good enough.

punchline.text: The best choice is often the first good one.

quiz.question: What did Barry Schwartz find about maximizers?
options: They get better outcomes but feel less happy
They are always happier with their choices
They make decisions faster than satisficers
